Rhucle.title: Monochrome
Rhucle.about:
'Monochrome' is the first collaboration album of Rhucle and Asami Tono. These tracks were made in Autumn 2023 to Winter 2024.
Asami Tono played beautiful piano and clear voices, Rhucle added synth and samples. We hope listeners relax with 'Monochrome'.

Rhucle.title: Place
Rhucle.label: Oxtail Recordings
Rhucle.about:
'Place' is a different album from other albums.
Oxtail and my relationship started in 2015. Four albums have been released from Oxtail so far. I think that listeners can understand the evolution of my sounds via those albums. Oxtail has supported my activities for so many years, I appreciate Mike Nigro.
I made those tracks in Summer to Winter 2023.
My equipment is getting simpler year after year. The sound of the tracks was made by some software synthesizers, samples and nature sounds recorded by myself.
My interest is what I make rather than what I use. I focus on how to make limited material and sounds.
Anyway, I focused on making listeners feel relaxed.
I hope that listeners feel like this music is their place.
- Rhucle
In 2024, both Rhucle and Oxtail Recordings celebrate our 10th anniversaries, and we've been working together nearly as long. I believe we share a commitment to artistic process and the evolution of work over time, and the duration of our relationship has allowed us to see each other move through various stages of our practices, and grow together.
Yuta has always been kind, gracious, and more than generous. I hold up our relationship as a prime example of the power of underground, independent, DIY music, and I tell people about it all the time: I have a friend who lives on the other side of the world, that I’ve shared gigs and meals with in NYC and Tokyo, that I never would’ve met any other way, because I made a Bandcamp page and he sent me an email.
- Mike Nigro, Oxtail Recordings
--
All tracks written, mixed, and mastered by Rhucle
Artwork by Jo Jarosinska

Rhucle.title: So Far, So Close
Rhucle.about:
Purchase CD-R from Home Normal:  homenormal.bandcamp.com/album/so-far-so-close
--
'So Far, So Close' is the follow-up to 2023's 'Summer Chronicles' from David Cordero and Rhucle. We're thrilled to be welcoming back another collaboration between these two leading artists in the organic ambient scene.
Both artists are known for their fragile ambient works with carefully constructed melodicism, and their debut together was highly celebrated. Their follow-up is once again a meditation on nature and the balance of our relationship to it and each other as we enter a new spring season, with the cover art by Rhucle himself reflecting this perfectly.
Here are some words from the artists:
'"So far, so close" is an example of how we feel when we work together. Despite geographical distance we are musically very close but at the same time physically we are very far from each other. Despite the geographical distance, the 11,242 kilometres that separates us has not prevented us from composing these new songs together.'
'For 'So Far, So Close' we worked in the same way as on ‘Summer Chronicles’. Our engine has been to send each other tracks, record over them in our studios and compose this new release between Cadiz and Tokyo.'
The reflection on geographical distance and yet the ability to create together is something that resonates deeply. Despite the strains of modern technology and the impact it has on mental health worldwide, as a label we are able to put out so much music due to modern technology and file sharing which is ever easier now. And yet, it is important to remember that what brings us together is not the form itself but the intention and connection we feel with others from different parts of the world with their own language, culture, timezone and ways of being.
It is important to remember and reflect on this essence in all our communication, and how privileged we are to be able to interact with each other in an organic, personal and creative way with kindness and humanity. 'So Far, So Close' is a reflection of what it means to be truly connected in these modern times, in the best of ways.
Thank you for listening.
Rhucle.credits:
released April 4, 2025
Written by David Cordero & Rhucle
Recorded between Tokyo (Japan) & Cádiz (Spain).
Mixed by Rhucle
Mastered by Ian Hawgood
Photography by Rhucle
copyright © 2025 Home Normal

Rhucle.title: Summer Chronicles
Rhucle.about:
Purchase compact disc from Home Normal:  homenormal.bandcamp.com/album/summer-chronicles
--
The first in our series of four David Cordero releases between 2023 and 2024 is a wonderful collaboration between himself and the great Japanese ambient composer, Rhucle. 'Summer Chronicles' marks the first collaboration between the pair, and the first release with Rhucle on Home Normal.
This album was created to reflect our memories of the summer of 2022. During several weeks we exchanged some sketches and over a number of edits and adjustments we were able to evolve the gentle sounds reflective of nature in that period that encompassed our vision for the organic work we were able to create together.
'Summer Chronicles' was titled by David as that summer he was playing the videogames 'Xenoblade Chronicles'. We felt the title brought together the sounds and textures of the album in its theme and focus perfectly.
The cover photo was taken by Rhucle in a nature park in Japan.
We hope you like this collection of songs.
Thank you for listening
Rhucle.credits:
released November 3, 2023
Written by David Cordero & Rhucle
Recorded between Tokyo (Japan) & Cádiz (Spain).
Mixed at Nada Nuevo Studio
Mastered by Ian Hawgood
Photography by Rhucle
copyright © 2023 Home Normal
all rights reserved

Rhucle.title: Threads
Rhucle.about:
Purchase cassette from Aural Canyon:  auralcanyonmusic.bandcamp.com/album/threads
--
'Threads' is an evocative exploration of soundscapes crafted by City Of Dawn and Rhucle.
This collaborative album weaves a delicate tapestry of serene melodies, atmospheric textures, & field recordings. Each track is a thread in a larger, mysterious narrative, inviting you to lose yourself in it's soothing embrace.
Rhucle.credits:
released March 21, 2025
All Tracks Written, Recorded & Mixed by City Of Dawn & Rhucle
Bass guitar on "Thoughts Mingle in Rain" by Marisa Grijalva
Mastered by Rhucle
Artwork by City Of Dawn & Rhucle
